intro: Fumaria × alberti, commonly known as the hybrid yellowweed, is a flowering plant in the family Fumariaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Papaveraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens.
